title: The National
body:
![The National](http://austinist.com/attachments/austin_anand/national.jpg "The National")

A few days ago we brought you [Bloodbuzz Ohio](http://admin.crackintheroad.com/?p=8), the lead single from the much anticipated new album **High Violet** from Brooklyn band **The National**. Now we are proud to be able to bring you another song from the forthcoming album which is released worldwide on the 10th of May. _Afraid Of Everyone_ is 5th in the track listing on **High Violet**, although it is a far darker approach than that heard on _Bloodbuzz Ohio_. It will do nothing to quell the comparisons to Ian Curtis’s **Joy Division**, and their is no doubt some influence taken from them. **Berninger** is in an anxious mood, as he mournfully pleas “_with my kid on my shoulders I try, not to heard anyone I like_“. Whilst it is not too far from the sound achieved on **Boxer**, it is more mature, especially in it’s lyrical content. This track adds further hype to what is already one of the most eagerly anticipated releases of the year.

[Afraid Of Everyone](http://www.mediafire.com/?jmuzmzohjjv)

[Official Site](http://www.americanmary.com/)
